text: Here's how to remove your Google account
from your Android device.
Note that these steps only remove access

to your Google account
from your Android device.
It does not actually delete your account,
so you can always add your Google account
back to your device at any time.
We are using an LG V40 ThinQ phone.
The exact steps may vary slightly
depending upon your device model.
It is important to note that
removing your account from your device
will also remove important information

that was stored through
the account on the device.
This includes email, contacts, settings,
and access to the Google Play store.

So it's probably a good
idea to back up your device
prior to removing your account.
To remove your Google account,
open your phone settings.
Tap on "Accounts,"

or it may be listed as "Users
& Accounts" on some devices.

Then tap on the account
that you want to remove,
and then click "Remove account."

You may be prompted to enter
your device's password or PIN
to finish removing the account.
